page.title: 01LAND IN STRETTON VALLEY
page.content: Our block is a{rural area}to the north of Church Stretton. The village of All Stretton lies in the valley between the hills. The Long Mynd with its batches is along the western side and Caer Caradoc and part of Helmeth stretch along the eastern edge. Nearer to Church Stretton there is a small housing estate and two schools. The primary school and the comprehensive school, for children up to 16, share the same site. Some children from both schools travel in by school bus from nearby villages. Three roads and a railway pass through the valley; the busy A49 road, the old Shrewsbury to Ludlow road and the very old Watling Street. Most visitors to Church Stretton go to see Carding Mill Valley. There are lots of beautiful views and on a clear day you can see for miles.
